message.content:
```json
{
  "filename": "awiqli-epar-product-information_en.pdf",
  "Document Type": "Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC)",
  "Product Name": "Awiqli / Awiqli 700 units/mL solution for injection in pre-filled pen (insulin icodec)",
  "Active Substance(s)": "insulin icodec (produced in Saccharomyces cerevisiae by recombinant DNA technology)",
  "Strength": "700 units/mL (equivalent to 26.8 mg), 1050 units/1.5 mL, 2100 units/3 mL",
  "Pharmaceutical Form": "Solution for injection in pre-filled pen (FlexTouch); Clear and colourless isotonic solution with pH approximately 7.4",
  "Route of Administration": "Subcutaneous use only",
  "Indications": "Treatment of diabetes mellitus: adults (type 1 and type 2), palliative care (once-weekly subcutaneous administration). Pediatric populations: not authorized",
  "Posology": "Unit of insulin icodec corresponds to 1 unit of other insulins. 700 units/mL strength. Strength options: 700, 1050, 2100 units. Initiation: 70-2100 units/week. Dosing: 10-700 units per injection, pre-filled pen delivers 10-700 units. Missed Dose: administer as soon as possible after recognizing (keeping weekly schedule). Adjustments: based on fasting plasma glucose. Elderly/Special Populations: No adjustment needed.",
  "Contraindications": "Hypersensitivity to active substance or excipients (listed in SPC)",
  "Special Warnings and Precautions": "Administer only subcutaneously. Single patient use. Do not use if solution not clear/colourless. Do not use if frozen. Use new needle per injection. Avoid mixing with other products/infusion fluids. Traceability document required. Hypoglycemia: risk factors, symptoms, management. Hyperglycemia: risk factors, symptoms. Lipodystrophy/cutaneous amyloidosis: regular injection site rotation. Avoid driving if high/low blood sugar risk. Mix-up errors: check insulin label, verify dose. Pioglitazone interaction (congestive heart failure risk). Children: not authorized <18 years.",
  "Marketing Authorisation Holder": "Novo Nordisk A/S",
  "Marketing Authorisation Number": "EU/1/24/1815/001, EU/1/24/1815/002, EU/1/24/1815/003, EU/1/24/1815/004, EU/1/24/1815/005, EU/1/24/1815/006, EU/1/24/1815/007, EU/1/24/1815/008, EU/1/24/1815/009, EU/1/24/1815/010, EU/1/24/1815/011, EU/1/24/1815/012, EU/1/24/1815/013, EU/1/24/1815/014",
  "Date of First Authorisation": "May 17, 2024",
  "Date of Latest Renewal": "Not specified",
  "Shelf Life": "3 years or 12 weeks after first opening (FlexTouch pen). Needles disposed immediately.",
  "Storage Conditions": "Before First Opening: Refrigerate (2°C - 8°C). Do not freeze. Keep cap on. After Opening/Carried Spare: Below 30°C (room temperature) or refrigerate. Do not freeze. Protect from light. Keep cap on. Avoid heat/direct light.",
  "Package Description": "Pre-filled pen (FlexTouch) with cartridge, plunger, seal, and yellow/green labeling. Packaging: Small immediate: unit pens. Medium: cartons with individual unit pens and needles. Large: Multipacks (e.g., 2 pens with 26/28 needles). Strength labels (700u/mL, FlexTouch). Material: Glass, Polypersox, Teflon.",
  "Legal Category": "Prescription Only Medication (Medical prescription required)",
  "ATC Code": "A10AE07 (Long-acting human insulin analogues)",
  "Manufacturers": "Novo Nordisk A/S (Denmark; Details: Bagsvaerd and Kalundborg locations for facilities). Quality management.",
  "Excipients": "Glycerol, metacresol, phenol, zinc acetate, sodium chloride, hydrochloric acid (adjustment), sodium hydroxide (adjustment), Water for injections."
}
```
message.reasoning:
Okay, let's approach this request methodically. I'm dealing with a detailed text about Awiqli's Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC) and need to extract information for 14 specified fields. 

First, I'll focus on the filename which is clearly provided in the header - awiqli-epar-product-information_en.pdf. That seems straightforward to extract.

For the Document Type, the text immediately mentions "SUMMARY OF PRODUCT CHARACTERISTICS" in the first section's header. This matches my understanding of what SmPC stands for - though technical knowledge about EPAR documents might be useful here.

Extracting the Product Name is simple too - the first section 1. NAME OF THE MEDICINAL PRODUCT states "Awiqli 700 units/mL solution for injection in pre-filled pen". The active substance appears in section 2. QUALITATIVE AND QUANTITATIVE COMPOSITION as "insulin icodec", and the valuations are mentioned later.

Strength extraction requires careful attention because it's mentioned multiple ways - "700 units/mL", "26.8 mg" and different packaging configurations. I'll compile all these variations that appear throughout the text.

Pharmaceutical Form is evident in section 3 - "Solution for injection in pre-filled pen" with FlexTouch, plus mentions of its physical properties. Route of Administration is clearly specified as subcutaneous use only in the description.

Indications come straight from section 4.1 - "Treatment of diabetes mellitus in adults". But I should also check if there are variations in formulation specifically for different populations.

The Posology section (4.2) covers a wide range of instructions for dose adjustment based on different patient profiles. I'll need to extract all these details systematically, including those for special populations and missed doses. 

Contraindications and Special Warnings are spread throughout sections 4.3 and 4.4 with valuable safety information. I'll need to consolidate these findings carefully. 

For the Marketing Authorisation details, sections 7, 8, 9 and 10 specify:
The Holder is Novo Nordisk A/S with its full address. 
Marketing Numbers are listed in section 8 with the specific coding. 
The First Authorisation date is May 17, 2024.

The Shelf Life (section 6.3) is clearly states "3 years", but there are more specific instructions about after-first-opening periods. Storage Conditions follow in section 6.4 and are thorough to extract.

Package Description appears mostly in annexes with comprehensive details about pen formats, materials and packaging components. Details are scattered but we can gather all options here.

Legal Category information appears in the small print text about medical prescription requirements. 
ATC Code is explicitly A10AE07 and tied to long-acting insulins. 
Manufacturers are detailed in Annex II and broader details in the main text, mostly aligned with Novo Nordisk as the sole manufacturer appears. 
Excipients are listed in section 6.1 - glycerol, metacresol phenol, zinc acetate, sodium chloride, hydrochloric acid, and sodium hydroxide.

I must be extremely careful to capture ALL relevant details without omitting anything, as the instructions stress. Each piece of information seems interconnected across different sections. Compiling this requires careful cross-referencing.
 
Let me proceed systematically to compile each field, keeping in mind the imperatives to include all partial information and not mark things as "Not found" without thorough verification.
